  • Package gui

    • Class gui.AboutMenu

      class AboutMenu extends JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backButton
          JButton backButton
          container for the level-preview. can be used to scroll through level-preview, if it is too big to be shown
        • mainPanel
          JPanel mainPanel
          top panel of the GUI window

    • Class gui.GameOverScreen

      class GameOverScreen extends JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • button1
          JButton button1
          Back to main menu button
        • highscores
          JLabel highscores
          shows "Highscore as text"
        • mainPanel
          JPanel mainPanel
          top panel of the GUI window
        • newHighScore
          JLabel newHighScore
          label that shows the current rank of the player/s in the scoreboard
        • pane1
          JScrollPane pane1
          scrollpane which contains the table for the scoreboard
        • pleaseEnterName
          JLabel pleaseEnterName
          indicate that the player has to enter his name
        • showScore
          JLabel showScore
          label to provide or show the score of the current user after a gameOver
        • table1
          JTable table1
          table, where name and highScore will be display
        • textField1
          JTextField textField1
          field, where the new HighScorer must enter his name

    • Class gui.GameSettingsMenu

      class GameSettingsMenu extends JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backButton
          JButton backButton
          brings the user back to the main menu
        • behaviourBRadioButton
          JRadioButton behaviourBRadioButton
          Button to set a second movement behaviour (Press a key every turn in order to move in the according direction.)
        • gameSpeedSlider
          JSlider gameSpeedSlider
          used to set the speed of the game / the delay for updating the game
        • levelPreviewPanel
          LevelPreviewPanel levelPreviewPanel
          the panel which shows the level-preview
        • levelScrollPane
          JScrollPane levelScrollPane
          container for the level-preview. can be used to scroll through level-preview, if it is too big to be shown
        • levelSelectionBox
          JComboBox<String> levelSelectionBox
          can be used to select a level/map to be played
        • livesSlider
          JSlider livesSlider
          used to set the lives of the player/s
        • mainPanel
          JPanel mainPanel
          top panel of the GUI window
        • mouthSpeedSlider
          JSlider mouthSpeedSlider
          used to set the speed of the animation for the mouth of the hungryball/s
        • outerLevelPanel
          JPanel outerLevelPanel
          containter for the level selection
        • standardRadioButton
          JRadioButton standardRadioButton
          Button to set the standard movement behaviour (Press a key once to move in the according direction until a wall is hit or the direction is changed.)
        • startButtonPanel
          JPanel startButtonPanel
          contains the star button
        • startGameButton
          JButton startGameButton
          starts the game

          JButton multiplayerButton
          brings the user to the gui window to set up a multiplayer game
        • singleplayerButton
          JButton singleplayerButton
          brings the user to the gui window to set up a singleplayer game

      class PaintPanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • blockSize
          int blockSize
          pixel size (width / height) of the individual tiles in the level

          holds objects which are to be painted.

  • Package ingameObjects

    • Class ingameObjects.Character

      class Character extends IngameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • direction
          int direction
          direction the Character is moving in: 0: static, 1: right, 2: up, -1: left, -2: down.

    • Class ingameObjects.Enemy

      class Enemy extends Character implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • color
          String color
          color of the sprite of the enemy,can be "yellow", "cyan", "red, "pink"
        • value
          int value
          The score the player gets for eating the Enemy.

    • Class ingameObjects.HungryBall

      class HungryBall extends Character implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • eatEnemyFilePath
          String eatEnemyFilePath
          the path to the audio file used to create a sound when the hungryball eats an Enemy object
        • eatEnemyPlayer
          AudioPlayer eatEnemyPlayer
          plays a sound when the HungryBall eats an Enemy object
        • eatPowerUpAudioFilePath
          String eatPowerUpAudioFilePath
          the path to the audio file used to create a sound when the hungryball eats a PowerUp object
        • eatPowerUpPlayer
          AudioPlayer eatPowerUpPlayer
          plays a sound when the HungryBall eats a PowerUp object
        • eatScorePointAudioFilePath
          String eatScorePointAudioFilePath
          the path to the audio file used to create a sound when the hungryball eats a ScorePoint object
        • eatScorePointPlayer
          AudioPlayer eatScorePointPlayer
          plays a sound when the HungryBall eats a ScorePoint object
        • game
          Game game
          the game in which the hungryball object acts as a player character
        • l
          Level l
          the level in which the hungryball is placed
        • lives
          int lives
          the amount of times the hungryball is allowed to get hit by enemies.
        • name
          String name
          the String, which is displayed as the players name in the game GUI.
        • score
          int score
          the highscore points that the player has currently earned.
        • undefeatable
          boolean undefeatable
          if true, the player can eat enemies during a collision, otherwise he loses a live.
        • undefeatableSprite
          String undefeatableSprite
          Path to the location of the sprite for the undefeatable state of the hungryball.
        • undefeatableTimer
          Timer undefeatableTimer
          sets undefeatable = false after a certain amount of time.

    • Class ingameObjects.IngameObject

      class IngameObject extends Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • isSpriteMirrored
          boolean isSpriteMirrored
          true = sprite should be mirrored along the y-axis, false if not mirrored
        • position_x
          int position_x
          the x-coordinate of the object placed in the level.
        • position_y
          int position_y
          the y-coordinate of the object placed in the level.
        • sprite
          String sprite
          Location of the sprite of the object
        • spriteQuadrantRotation
          int spriteQuadrantRotation
          tilt of the sprite 0 = 0Â°, 1 = 90Â°, -1 = -90Â° ...
